What should you say when you are turning in a job application in fast-food restaurant in order to sound professional? In: Management and Strategy , Hiring and Retention [ Edit categories ]
Answer: Ask to speak with the Manager. Hand them the application, extend your hand for a handshake, look them in the eye and say, I would really appreciate being considered for the position, if you need any clarification about anything on my application, please don't hesitate to ask. Also, it can depend on what position you're applying for. If it's NOT a management position, you may want to make yourself stand out, and not be soooo professional buy saying something like: I think you'll find my application is "sizzling". It shows a sense of personality and humor, and the manager will probably remember you over other candidates.
